dt: {bc}to prove wrong by argument or evidence {bc}show to be false or {d_link|erroneous|erroneous}

quotes.t: It is not necessary to {qword}refute{/qword} such an argument point by point …
We {qword}refute{/qword} these aspersions whether they come from our best friends or our worst foes.

subsource.source: in Nathan Aus, ed., {it}Voices of History 1945–46{/it}

quotes.t: And it violates the basic tenet of historical method: that the historian be alert to the negative instances that would {qword}refute{/qword} his thesis and to alternative explanations that would be more plausible than his own.
But for every study that shows acid rain is damaging frogs, another one {qword}refutes{/qword} it.

shortdef: to prove wrong by argument or evidence : show to be false or erroneous
